Generation VI.X: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Generation VI.Y: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

Generation VII.Sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
Generation VII.Moon: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another's jewels.

Generation VIII.Sword: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
Generation VIII.Shield: It's said that somewhere in the world, there's a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It's also said that this pack has a queen .

Generation IX.Scarlet: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Generation IX.Violet: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.

Generation VII.Sun: Ten Carat Hill , Vast Poni Canyon , Poké Pelago
Generation VII.Moon: Ten Carat Hill , Vast Poni Canyon , Poké Pelago
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Ten Carat Hill , Vast Poni Canyon
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Ten Carat Hill , Vast Poni Canyon
